title: Parmesan Lemon Crusted Flounder with Green Beans Amandine

ingredients.name: fresh green beans (trimmed and cut in half)
juice and zest of 1 lemon (juice divided)

instructions: Preheat the oven to 375° F. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray and set it aside. Add the water to a large soup pot over high heat and bring to a boil.
In a small bowl, combine the panko bread crumbs, lemon zest, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, and half of the garlic. Mix until well-combined.

Lay the fish fillets on the prepared baking sheet and brush each with egg white. Press 2 Tbsp of the panko mixture onto the top of each fillet. Drizzle with 2 Tbsp of the lemon juice. Spray the top of each fillet with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes.
While the fish is baking, blanch the green beans in the boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Add the margarine to a nonstick sauté pan over medium heat. Add the remaining garlic, the almonds, and the green beans, and sauté for 4 to 5 minutes.
Drizzle the green beans with the remaining 2 Tbsp of lemon juice and sauté for 2 more minutes.
Serve 1 fish fillet with 1 cup green beans and 1/2 cup brown rice (optional)
